lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Before we jump into tonight's episode, we do have some announcements to get through, beginning with the first of our two sponsors tonight. Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is going on? Taliesin, Elderwood Academy wants me, Sam Riegel, to do the sponsorship tonight, a-heh, and not you, okay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are you talking about? I am Sam Riegel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can't you tell by my inane smile and my spongy feeble hands?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no, no, no, nice try, but come on, everybody here knows that I'm the real Sam Riegel, right, guys? I mean...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, you both seem really bad at sports.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, look, look at my cow-sized teeth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Look at my lack of human emotion and overwhelming hubris.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, they're both really annoying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Candidate A, how much does a carton of milk cost?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, not very much, somewhere between $100 to $400, I presume.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Candidate B, what is something you'd say to your pet dog?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You run their hand across their, I want to say hair and you call them an excellent canine and then fetch your butler to go disinfect your hands right afterwards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Candidate A, if you could have lunch with any celebrity, living or dead, who would it be?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Myself, of course. What a stupid question, Marisha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What is the URL of tonight's sponsor?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hold on a second, I've got it right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, that's Sam, most definitely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't fake that kind of insincerity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love you guys. Back to you, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter) Our second sponsor tonight, our returning friends since the beginning of this campaign, our friends at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're giving away a free dice of healing set to anybody who's a subscriber this month as part of this anniversary, so enjoy and happy anniversary to you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you should sign in and do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's stuff printed on the pages even?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have the trade paperback as you saw and with the wonderful cover art there from our good critter friend, William Kirkby, which you probably have seen his art through many of our galleries and stuff online, he's amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is also the hardcover limited edition version of Volume II, which sits alongside the Volume I.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, it's pretty intense, works within the story and themes of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The limited edition is available exclusively through Critical Role, it's, like, our own program.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You even ruined our own name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're done, we're done, I'm out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Last but not least, Laura, you had something to talk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it's just a little thing, but we were off last week, but while we were off, this went on sale and I had to show it off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is! It's a Frumpkin little hanging plushy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so cute and it would make a great Christmas ornament,

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just don't drop it or it goes (poofing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't send him to go looking for anything because he won't find it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keep out the reach of guards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to see him, Liam?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then keep him on your desk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ooh! I'm a dog person now, but I still love him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, I believe with that, it is time for us to jump into tonight's episode of...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I had to finish it, it was hard to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Somebody cover her up in dirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what would you like to do, Mighty Nein?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you have your morning constitutional? (laughter) Or is that just you waking up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I suppose we should start setting up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But the people, can we peek outside? Are there still a bunch of people, like, running around looking worried?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there bodies on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could see now from above that she is currently gathering with those individuals, prepping them and making sure that everyone who is leaving today has everything they need, because it is a one way trip for them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, and she's going to-- Wait.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have we already set up the dispersal for-- we were going to give everyone a little money right before they--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to give them a to-go bag or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So if-- you remember what I gave you guys, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So if everybody gives me back 112 gold and I don't give Vilya any gold but Vilya you'll still get a bunch of platinum, is that okay with you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not imminent, the people aren't, like, getting ready to leave now, but you gather probably in the next couple of hours or so, they'll probably be shoving off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's 60 people roughly leaving that will get 50 gold each.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll also give an extra 50 for Vilya because...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So she can get 50 gold, yeah, that's great, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well yeah, I mean she's got a family that she's got to get back to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll also give 50 gold to Vilya.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So she gets 150 gold, that's wonderful.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why don't we make it an even 200?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Might as well, I don't know what I'm going to do with this money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all throwing in, but if you guys don't

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's one of those situations where the gratuity is already on the receipt and that's already been taken care of.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 250 gold for Vilya, cool cool cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Who knows, you know, if she has to go home to her family, if she has to take care of her family.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or an entire village of people, you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She grew a leg out of plants, I think she's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, did you want to give 50 gold to Vilya?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marisha, you need that flashlight on right now? Is that something you need?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much is she getting right now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was wondering what that was.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beau, turn your stupid gloves off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give me back my driftglobe. What are you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's somebody's mother, I'm just saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, she's been here for so long that her kids are grown up by now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "I have a family." We need to do an insight check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sounds like a good cover story.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just what she wants you to think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One, two, three, four, five, six--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So while Vilya is organizing the exodus, I mean, should we ask her if she needs any help or anything or do we just turn our attention to--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We only have, like, six more days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you need? Go ahead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You go first, I was very impressed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you need from us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I think we probably need to build a stage, right? We need to have some sort of area where everyone can congregate, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't want people getting in fights; they need to be distracted.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fights are a lot of fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We should make a fighting ring!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can make a fighting ring!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and we can make it in the shape of, like, a circle and we can throw some little balls in there and stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that thematically connect with-- I mean this is a religious pilgrimage, correct? I mean, does that--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like chaos and mayhem--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe, like, food fighting or something, I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like something you could throw at people, but it doesn't hurt too much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like a little cafe, but you have to fight for your food while you're in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But like, not aggressively, just like pie fighting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, maybe a big wall where people can draw stuff.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are we right now? Are we still in our digs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still in Vilya's chambers right now, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess, Jes, what's the overall goal? What is the culminating climactic event of Traveler Con? What are we aiming at?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You are sweating so much right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Well, it's warm in here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Apple does not fall far from the branch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So he's got to be seen that way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So the ascension rite is the main event?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's the culmination of everything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, do you know where you'd like that to happen?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we can't actually rite-- he can't actually ascend because he's not a god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but he can shoot up into the sky or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, what if I asked people, like, "Hey guys, we need a few human sacrifices." you know? What if, like, a few people volunteered for that? Maybe one of you guys would be one of the volunteers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to kill one of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Terribly sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I had a moment thought I'd come in and see how things are going on."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I run over and I give him a hug.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So did you hear what I was saying about human sacrifice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's about as much as I got and I'm very interested to hear how this has going to work."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we ask people to be a human sacrifice, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We take the volunteers, we drag them off to, like, the volcano or something--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: However you prepare people for sacrifice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then we alter their memories.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you done that before? Oh, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We change their memories and I bet you can do it too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've altered a few memories in my time."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we alter their memories and make them think that they were sacrificed and that they saw-- they were brought back to life, watching you ascend into the heavens.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So not just the sacrifice, but this act brought them back to life.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like what if, one, we don't actually make them think that they were sacrificed. We could make it be like, "Just kidding, we just want to see who really loved the Traveler, as a present for really loving him, you get to see the Ascension." There's that one, or we can make them think that they really died.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really died and then because of the Ascension they were brought back to life?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then they go back and they're, like, really believing it so then they tell everybody that they watched him ascend.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love it, that's great stagecraft and it's really excellent production value.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will say, as someone who has dabbled religiously, the human sacrifice angle sets a dangerous precedent? I mean, is this just going to become a thing that other people do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well I thought that-- you know, I just figured that might be something that was needed for ascending.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While I don't particularly ascribe to all the ideals of your mistress--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You do have quite a bit of experience with the fanaticals so maybe you'd be the right partner for this planning endeavor. Would you be interested?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, while I'm obviously not a believer, I am here to help. There's room for a lot at the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The people who we get to sacrifice themselves, or--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: However we do it, if human sacrifice is not the way we can figure something out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that okay with both you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you ever met anyone who thinks that they came back from the dead? Remember Molly? He was insufferable. God, the ego.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just saying, we could be creating egomaniacs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you just say, "Do you remember Molly?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, not like, "Do you remember Molly?" but like, do you remember his shitty disposition?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was it? How long ago was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been almost half a year.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A number of months, at least, a number of months, at least.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So maybe it's just like, you know, they don't actually think that they died, maybe it's, you know, they got the blessing because they were so devoted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Peter Fawn, and it was-- there was lots of stagecraft and stuff, but towards the end of the play, they did this thing where there was a fey creature, a little fey pixie creature that died and they were like, "Everyone in the audience needs to clap to bring the faith creature back to life again." So the audience participating in the event, made you really feel for that character so much so what I'm saying is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Strangely, that is an actual ritual that works."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wow, it's based in fact?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not that I've seen it. I hate the theater. Go on."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They all had to bang on drums!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's amazing. Maybe during the week you said something like, "We should all give them a fun activity." Maybe it's making their drum stick or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And they all look like dicks!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! And then at the end of the week they all beat their dicks as hard as they can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just beat that dick as hard as you can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They'd make a little tiny drum roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then they'll make the Traveler just shoot up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What if, what if they pray-- beat, whatever-- too hard and it destroys me?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're left with the guilt and I'm home free."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you beat it so hard that it can kill someone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've heard of dicks falling off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They had to be really infected, almost like-- But they've fallen off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, though, why that choice? Why leave them with, you know, prolonged and insufferable guilt for something that they didn't actually do when it could be spun a little bit more positively?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perhaps we give them a big party and if it does not reach the climax that they were hoping for, then they have to redouble their efforts and continue their faith and try harder, into the future.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it better if the Traveler dies, no offense.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know, I like it better that way, because then they can move on to another god and they're not trapped forever believing in something that's not going to help them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I can get behind that, but maybe we sidestep the "it's their fault" thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If it was something like it's an ecstatic death, like he is obliterated so that he can go forth into the heavens never to be seen again and that's something that he wanted?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is there a way to, like, pass the divine buck, even?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, I mean, what if we said like, "Oh my gosh, you know what? The Traveler has been super buddy-buddy with, I don't know, the Wild Mother or something."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "The Moon Weaver or something, and the Traveler is now telling you like, 'Oh, you should worship this other person,' because they're, like, best friends or something."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just to be clear, though, and it seems like this ship has sailed, but there isn't any chance you would want to actually try to be the thing that these people think that you are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "God no, there's way too much responsibility."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just surprised that there's so much responsibility for what is essentially a chaos religion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want to do my things, not their things."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't take you to be a creature of the whim."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But in the sense that it's whatever I want to do, whenever and I do not want anybody else to tell me not to do it."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there anything you just don't like to do or-- other than the theater?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There needs to be a fun element of it, which means a bit of misery to those that probably deserve it and a bit of laughter for those that don't."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you like to get your hands on life and just squeeze it for all it's worth?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I may, have you made yourself as available to these people that are arriving as you have to Jester over time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I assumed it would be the same experience elsewhere, but you're one of a kind. Most everyone else in this world is-- well, dreary, boring, aggressively selfish.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, what was her name? Celia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Celia, yes. (laughs) She found one of your pamphlets actually."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, sorry about that, but oof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look, she's a bit of a bitch, but that cruelty makes for some fun pranks on occasion."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I bet she does some really mean ones, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's one of the ones I'd like to possibly--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It certainly gives you a sense of joy and completion to be going around and spreading a little dissidence and-- to be going around and spreading a little dissidence and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And frivolity, I guess, I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure, but just to set them free to do their own thing and especially if their own thing is kind of what they were doing already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, and if what they're doing is fun and they want me to come help, maybe I'll stay for some fun."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we can keep you out of it, if you like.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus, what does the Moon Weaver look like generally?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm not very up to speed on some of your 'gods.'"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: From what I remember from the few times that we've had to run it, it's not chaos necessarily, but some trickstery-ish stuff, a little bit of a lighthearted disguise and silliness, a little bit of-- oh man, this has been a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm familiar with the Moon Weaver, I'm just seeing what your information is."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you-- what is the Moon Weaver like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some similar ideas of trickery, though they're--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're a little more, I don't know, esoteric and mysterious. I like to be a little more present."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could make a bit of a heavier subset of that, if you know what I mean, kind of a...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A little bit of more chaos, less illusion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm surprised you're interested in passing followers off to someone who isn't your purview."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, there's room for a lot in this world and if you have a whole planet of carpenters, then nothing ever gets done. You need a bit of everything and we're fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was only wondering, if we are doing this hand off to the Moon Weaver, it might help, only because our means are limited, if you had the ability to, I don't know, create some sort of grand show as the Moon Weaver and officially usher them over, maybe not appearing as yourself, but as this deity, then it might help move things along.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or a face of the Moon Weaver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What are they going to do? Be frustrated that we shunt some more followers their way? They'll be fine."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's way better than my human sacrifice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we're planning to frame this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, wait, we're losing the sacrifice element?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I guess we don't have to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's probably for the best. That just leads to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we just said, like, "Oh, I need sacrifices to be skinned, but you stay alive or something."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That feels darker than actually dying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't throw any ideas off the table yet until we've had a full discussion."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if it's someone who raises her hand as like, "I'll volunteer," and this lovely woman walks out and volunteers to be the human sacrifice and is brought, you know, into the lava pit or whatever and then all of a sudden wings sprout out of her and she shoots up into the sky, like it was a-- like it was planned or some-- I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I-- I mean, I could, but I feel like these are still so new and I feel like I-- I don't want to betray the Storm Lord in any way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. What if, like, you brought a bunch of followers to the Moon Weaver and then he was like, "Fuck you, I'm taking the wings back."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just want to say, you know, putting the human sacrifice thing, you know, you do it once and it goes on the calendar and then there's going to be, like, a human sacrifice anniversary holiday.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And they'll keep doing it and then 20 years like, Vokodo or Rumblecusp is known for its cannibalism and human sacrifice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm literally the descendant of people who buried a head somewhere and this is sort of how we ended up where we are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about this, how about this, how about this? We're spitballing here. There's no bad ideas.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because we do want them to give of themselves somehow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if it's not sacrifice? What if it's not killing, bloodletting, any of that stuff? What if it's, like, a 24-hour sweat lodge sort of like-- fasting--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: where people are dropping and dropping and dropping--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: -- and can they make it, can they make it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You have to dance for your life.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And that person will sort of initiate the rites of Ascension by--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we take all of the dick statues that they made for you and instead of giving them away as party favors, we hide them all around the village--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- and you go on a dick hunt!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then once all the dicks are found, then that triggers the Ascension.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure, what if they find the dicks and then they have to do a pilgrimage up the mountain to the volcano and they have to toss their dick in the volcano?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do you feel about a human avatar, like, a chosen one? You could always just pass a cloak onto that one and then it would become-- I don't know if you want that kind of responsibility for being a high priest of a god that's wandered off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I mean, I'm not opposed to it, becoming, like, a high priestess, but--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But also every single person trying to connect with the Traveler will then come to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How would they even find me? We travel around so much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't you just send messages to some people anywhere they are at any time?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seems like it might be easy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For other people to do it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are quite a few people here who I've taught the same thing to."

lines.name: LAURA
